favourite.article: Amid life's turmoil count your blessings!
God has bless me with this hymn.
Not always do one come across such a lovely hymn. This is a big reminder to us from God especially when we fret. May God's name ever be held holy.
Whenever I have challenges or worries I sing this song and the joy and relief that comes with it can only be imagined. I thank God for His blessings.

Remember when? I do remember some 65 years ago, as a young boy sitting alone in calm pleasant surroundings, listening and looking up on a high whilte blank wall, gazing a long time upon a lone large beautiful picture of a man called Jesus. I felt in my body that He put His love on m . He said I will came and live with you. "Do not be discouraged, I am God over all, I will help you." Though the years the message and comfort this tune has give me has been an anchor and the promise that Jesus Christ lives. That He keeps His promises. He says, "I tell you the truth."
Nice and lovely hymns, so inspiring also I feel refreshed in spirit. I decree in the name of JESUS be blessed.
This song is a blessing. All glory remain to God Almighty forever.

Going through the lyrics of this song, my mind raced, to the scripture in Psalm 103:3-5 , and I couldn't but started recounting, and appreciating the numerous benefits, I have enjoyed from Him. The primary and major blessing; forgiving, and cleansing my iniquities, cost him, His only begotten son. To forget that, and to disregard it, will mean grieving Him. Oh God! I receive grace, not to forget.
Going through challenge of life but this hymn as really give me hope in Christ. am inspired. More anointing to the writer and the promoter of the gospel of Christ.
I am closing 2015. I love every bit of this lovely song. Listen to it any day any time and you will get the comfort in life. God bless you.
I just love the rhythm and the instruments, fully God bless.

I appreciate the many experiential comments on this song. Some I especially found enlightening are: Linda 1/26/15, Oliyomi 9/14/14, Rosalind 12/16/13, E. C. 9/12/13, Ken 8/19/12, Emmanuel 3/1/12, Frank 2/22/12, Hugh 4/3/10. --------------------- "The great singer of psalms in the Bible was David. And his advice was to 'sing praises unto the Lord.' It's good advice, too - especially when we've got so much to be thankful for, so much to sing about. 'Count your blessings, name them one by one.' We know the Source of all these blessings we receive; we know where they come from. So in this wonderful happy hymn we count these blessings, and give thanks." - Tennessee Ernie Ford (1919-91)

Now 66 I first heard this lovely hymn in the little gospel mission in Gt Harwood when Frank Talbot was pastor. He has been with the Lord many years now but this beautiful hymn always takes me back to my beginnings and when I count my blessings he and all the faithful Sunday school teachers are included.
I love this so much my granddad ran a Misson hall when I was young. We would go on Sunday school outings and sing this and many others.
My Mum always playing this on the piano during the 1940/50. Now playing at my local Church. St.Marys of Hermitage.

May we count our blessings and see what the Lord has done in Jesus' Name. Yes, it seems as if where is God but remember His words cannot fail. His words will surely come to pass in your life, in my life in Jesus Name. Trust on, Trust on, Believer Though Dark the night may be. We will surely rejoice at the end in Jesus Name. Thanks for uploading this song and God bless you all. Shalom!!!
Quite a good one. But must beautify it.

More often than not and especially when we are facing difficulties, we forget what GOD has done for us in the past. When I look back and see what GOD has done for me, I feel so humbled and short of words to thank HIM. May GOD help me to never forget all the Blessings He has bestowed upon us. Thank You GOD for this far you have brought me, for all that You have done/continued doing for me... May Your Name be Glorified forever.

When my mother was very sick, stricken with stroke and all my friends where nowhere to be found, this song gave me courage and gave me hope beyond this world..She finally rested from the pain but full of smile and joy. The song has been my reason for living and find hope in Jesus.

Just yesterday amid the so great a confliict I was getting tired of talking to God, my husband opened my eyes to see the great and awesome blessings, mercy, miracles, deliverance, mighty hands upon our lives just before now... Soon I forgot all my worries, asked for forgiveness for being ungrateful and started praising Him... Let's praise/thank God more dan we ask of Him because He dwells in the praises of His people.....Philippians 1:6.

This appears to be my favorite hymn. If I can put in one word what God has done and still is doing in my life, it will be "awesome". Nothing is worth to pay for his kind gestures. But to say thank you. Because if we try to pay Him for everything, we will stay indebted to Him forever. Though we are indebted to God forever!

I love this hymn. Any time I sing it, it reminds me and indeed every Christian that no matter what one passes or one is passing through, your blessing from God is constantly available. just Count them, they are innumerable!!!!! MY LORD IS GREAT!
This is my favourite song, whenever I have a feeling that things are not going well I will begin to sing this songs and begin to imagine d good things God had done for me before.
Amen... thank You Lord!

This song lifted my spirit this morning when we sang it in church. It's very real. No matter the conflicts we encounter, if we take time to count our blessing, it would be clear the blessing of God upon our lives.
The words in this hymn reveals to us the presence of God in our lives. We serve a living God.
It's been on my mind this morning. I have it in my akan hymnal just wanted to check online for the English version. God is so good indeed. He is the hope of life. Focus on Him and you will be saved.

My 17 yr old grandson died in a car accident in August of 2012. Two weeks after the accident I started humming this song. The odd thing about it was my daughter was humming the song at the same time even though we live 20 miles from each other. God is still good and still continues to Bless us even though we lost one of the most precious person in this life. We continue to count our Blessings. It helps us to get through each day.
Alwas count your blessings cos God is really faithful.

This song came to my mind this morning, and it occurred to me that maybe the LORD had something to say to me through it. So I looked it up online to see all of the verses, not just the chorus running through my head, and also perhaps the back story. I was blessed by the words once again, and God's work in other people's lives seen in the comments.
Oooh Whenever am happy I like to raise this song to myself because I can't count all that the Lord has done to me.
I'm blessed by this hymn any time I sing it. It propels me to thank God always. God is good!
The hymn inspired me in appreciating GOD.
Every time I listen to this song am encouraged that this far I have come, I can only say that God you are Ebenezer. Thank You God for blessing me. Amen.
This song encourages me to fight forward. As l am alone without siblings, life is difficult with me but when I turn back star naming my blessings one by one I see how good the Lord has been with me.
Glory be to God Almighty for He is always 'awesome'. This lyrics are just too much in my life. Halleluyah, Amen.

It is a good practice to have God's blessings, favours and faithfulness to you documented with dates. They are your trophies when you feel discouraged, tempted , depressed or burdened. I was pleasantly surprised today, to see what I had written down a year ago. They were many!!! The truth is that I had either forgotten many of those things OR I had taken them for granted. PLEASE ALWAYS DOCUMENT THEM. Like David presented his trophies to Saul (1 Sam. 17:34-37). They are your trophies!!!!

I thank God for the life of this writer. This song indeed reminds me of where I'm coming from, hoping that I will surely get to where God has destined me to be. In fact it's surprises me what the LORD is doing in my life.
I thank God for the lyrics of this song, which I sing with utmost gaiety. Indeed, His blessings are immeasurable and glorious.
This is my favorite hymn. Indeed my blessings are many, Haleluya.
Oh, what an inspirational song!! This song encourages me day in, day out.
Halleluyah to the Lamb of God. This is hymn is my long time favourite. I love it and today it is my anchor through that which I am going through.

This song shared a sure and easiest way to facing and overcoming life challenges. Counting ones past and present blessing will give hope and assurance of a better tomorrow. I often recourse to the song in the face of any life challenge and it has perfectly worked for me. Glory to God
This is a particular song that I can't explain the feelings that takes over me whenever I sing it. My whole person feels renewed whenever I do this song. It is a very special one for me.
This hymn is a total blessing to the world at large without regard to religious inclination.
Am blessed and inspired by these song... The wordings encourages me in my Christian faith... God is ever faithful.
God is faithful!
Thanks - simple but fine!
This hymn Blesses my heart so much. The Lord have done so much much for me continually.
It's a very nice hymn that I love so much from my primary school day. This I use in taking stock of what the LORD has done for me over the years.

One should never stray from this simple word. I used to think this hymn was of less value than those of a so-called higher truths. But I was wrong. I'll never despise this hymn again. I want to be like a child, just trusting and believing in my wonderful God. I won't despise the small thanks I can give every day. I'm convinced my Lord loves them :)
The antidote to depression! How much more joy-filled we could be if we followed this simple step every day.
I love this hymn! My mother would often sing this while she was doing tasks around the house! Thank you!!!

Praise God for the message in this song for many are the times the Devil wants to cheat me that I have nothing compared to my friends. He even mentions the names of the friends he thinks are better than I am BUT as soon as this hymn comes to my mind as I start singing it he disappears faster than he came. Praise be to God.
Amen and amen. Praise be the Almighty. Always. What a wonderful cheerful hymn. I did not know it, but learned just now. Thank you.

I googled " Lord why is my name Tempest?" and this was the first thing that came up. It touched my heart to hear all the beautiful things people had to say about this song and how it gives them hope. I love the Lord with all my heart and I am very happy to be lead to this page. 143.. God is Good.

I am very uplifted by this beatiful hymn, it reminds of the far God has taken me from, it reminds me of all the the good things that God has done for me ever since I came to this world now I am sure He will never leave nor forsake me.

This song is really beautiful. It is a spirit lifter when you feel discouraged and all hope is lost. God has done a lot for us. We need to always remember what He has done rather than focusing on little challenges!!!

I love this song, as it reminds me of the greatness of ny Lord. Though I am weak, I know He is strong! He blesses me with gifts that I never thought of. I realized my ungratefulness to my God. But this song keeps me humble and reminds me that I am my Father 's daughter! A princess!

I was really encouraged by this beautiful hymn. If I sum up my whole life, my life was full of bunch of complaints even after I was saved.
I kept complaining that I was born and am from Korea. I kept envying White Europeans or Americas, but the Lord answered me that He will use this Asian to be a part of Americans to show forth His glory. (I still gotta learn more about that, but my complaint about that decreased through the grace, love, and blessing of God.)
For my parents prepared to immigrate to the United States from 9 years ago, and we came here in June last year and got permanent residence 3 weeks after we came here.
I also complained that I am not good at anything, but the Lord gave me some talents at remembering dates, people, people's last name, what day a day is, finding a destination to help my dad who drives my family's car, a lot of interest in map, etc.
I am a nursing major, but recently, I am constantly and humbly praying to the Lord to guide me to go to another university to study about geography especially maps.
Lord, thank you for giving me a lot of blessings. Whenever I am depressed about my weakness or envy other people's appearance or talents, I will always count all my blessings that You have provided.

My grandmother used to sing this song to us (in Armenian) when we were children. The last time I had heard it was probably around ten. I hummed it to myself for many many years, until I heard it in English one day a year or so ago! It brought back a flood of soothing memories. No matter what our circumstances, we can always find blessings that God has bestowed on us, and be so thankful for them!!

I lost my job last year, and still unemployed, however, when I sing this song which is daily, I know that I have been blessed. I look back at all the blessings God has bestowed on me over the years and I'm so thankful and grateful to the Almighty. I know and believe that the right job will come my way. Thank You Lord for all the wonderful blessings. Amen.

Truly God gave me comfort through this song when I was going through a difficult time. I bless the name of God mightily. May you find solace in the arms of God in times of your difficulties. God bless you all.

Hmmmm, can't stop playing this song. I remember when my family and I, we were so faithful serving God, then we had nothing, but today we have been lifted. God has highly blessed us. We are now a blessing to people. This song reminds me of those days. As long as you remain faithful serving God He will never neglect you. THANK GOD!!!!

I'm so blessed to be part of a worldwide community of God's people who are counting the blessings of God over their lives even through adversity. I was reminded yesterday that His sufferings are not completed in that He still intercedes for us and shares our sorrows and carries our griefs - this too is a great blessing! Thank you for posting the song, thanks for the uplifting comments from everyone around the world and thank God for this beautiful reminder in song to count our blessings. I love you my brothers and sisters - we'll all meet one day with our glorious Saviour Yeshua! What joy and blessing that will be!

This morning, I received an email from a friend in which he spoke with loving appreciation of his wife. It reminded me that I too have good cause to appreciate the blessings my wife brings, and to "count my blessings". Those few words stirred up memories of singing them in Sunday School some 60 years ago. I could remember the first verse, and the chorus, only fragments of the remainder. How wonderful to be able to find all the words on the internet, and to be reminded of their truth and encouragement. Thank You.
When I look back and see how far the Lord has brought me I always count the blessings and it surprises me what the Lord has done. I will always count the blessings and name them one by one....

Thank you for posting this song. My mother used to sing it often before she passed to the LORD. So, how can I give up Jesus? I must sing this song knowing I shall one day sing it over and over with my mother as we give glory to the King of kings - my Lord Jesus. Oh,my heart swells with joy - again, thank you.

Thank you so much for putting this on the internet:-) It is so cheering and just the refocusing I desperately needed. This beautiful simple song turns my thoughts back to the goodness of God and all He has done! It is one of those songs that remind us that others too have walked with Jesus through difficult times. He is faithful and He is not worried or flustered. He is the answer and will make all things beautiful in His time.
Today is my birthday and this is song of the day for me. I started the morning by counting them all, one by one.
Whenever God sees you counting your blessings, He is compelled to add, for He begins to realize that you have an attitude of gratitude. Our job is to keep counting. His is to keep adding.

Years ago I was an usher during Christian gatherings. When I was asked to count the number of attendees, I would often sing "count your blessings" as I would count each person there. Every brother and sister, in whatever situation or condition they are in, is a "blessing" of God!

The stanza 3 of this song is a constant reminder that when you look at others with all that they have its easier to lose sight of what you have. So when it feels that I am overwhelmed by all around this comes to mind as a reminder of the blessings that I have.
Whenever I am feeling discouraged, I used to hear this song. Yeah, really wonderful healing song. I love this song. This song will show me how He is loving me.
This song is timely. Thank God for the gift of this hymn.
This song strengthens me as I daily fight the battles of my life thanks to the author of the song.
Amen!

In life there are times when we are low and feel as though everything is against us, and we easily forget all the good things (blessings) the Lord has showered on us in the past and continues to. We tend to focus on what we don't have or wish we had, instead of what we already have. I like this hymn because it draws our attention to all the things we ought to be thankful for (many of them money cannot buy) - and indeed they are numerous.

In the Old Testament the basic thought with respect to blessing is that of bringing people into God's presence. But in the New Testament the Apostle, coming with God, not only brought people into the presence of God; he also brought God into them. There is a great difference between the Old Testament pattern of blessing by the priests and the New Testament pattern of blessing by the Apostle. The New Testament blessing is much higher and deeper. On the one hand, to bless others is to bring them into the presence of God; on the other hand, it is to bring God into them as love, grace, and fellowship.
All Christians are familiar with the word blessing. One hymn even says, "Count your blessings, name them one by one." Undoubtedly, the concept of blessing expressed in this hymn is that blessing is a matter of being given a good wife, children, education, promotions, houses, and cars. According to this hymn, these are the blessings we should count one by one. More than thirty-five years ago, I sang this hymn during the last few hours of the year. I would gather some together and say, "Let us count the blessings of this past year, one by one." But the blessing according to the pure Word is much different from this. According to the Old Testament pattern of the blessing by the priest and the New Testament pattern of blessing by the Apostle, the proper blessing is to bring people into the presence of God and to bring God into them as grace, love, and fellowship that they may enjoy the Triune God, the Father, the Son, and the Spirit. Hence, blessing is a matter of enjoying the Triune God.
Source: Life-study of Genesis, chapter 95.
